intro: Acrossanthes lhotskyanus, commonly known as the Lhotsky's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
